item.title: Stone chipping are being allowed to get onto the highway every time cars leave the drive, 8th July
item.description:
Stones have been leaving the drive of number 37 and spreading onto the road and causing the wearing course to deteriorate causing more loose stones on the highway which take flight when cars run over them. This is an ongoing problem over a number of years and has been reported on numerous occasions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Raleigh Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 8th July
item.description:
I have been picking up litter as a street friend for three years and this area is particularly bad. Someone has dumped five or six bags of food waste, a lot of which is Kentucky fried chicken, which suggests it may have been from a commercial enterprise. I have picked up most of the scattered rubbish near the bags but they must be collected soon or foxes will try and gain access again. As a council you need to be much more proactive around here as the problem never seems to be resolved. Stick signs up warning of penalties or install cctv or contact the sports ground(Crystal Palace) for their help in tackling this anti- social behaviour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worsley Bridge Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Tree - worsened, 8th July
item.description:
Along the pavement by Ensign House, there is a designated area for six trees. Unfortunately, one of the trees is missing. The soil in that spot has become compacted and not even grass is growing there. Need to plant a tree in this location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sweden Gate, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
